title: What is the currency name of Sweden? - Quora

response.answer_text: Our currency is Krona, SEK, since 1873. We quite recently replaced our banknotes and the ones we currently use (well, more on that soon) are: 20 SEK depicturing Astrid Lindgren 50 SEK with Evert Taube 100 SEK featuring Greta Garbo 200 SEK with Ingemar Bergman 500 SEK that has Birgit Nilsson on them and finally 1000 SEK with Dag Hammarskjöld Find them here: Giltiga sedlar For coins, we currently have 4 different, 1, 2, 5 and 10 SEK. You can see them here: https://www.riksbank.se/sv/betalningar--kontanter/sedlar--mynt/mynt/giltiga-mynt/ Swedes hardly use cash any longer and many stores, even quite large ones, no longer accept cash as payment. Credit Card only. We are also fond users of “Swish” which is an interbank application where you can transfer money between persons instantly using your phone. More and more companies also join Swish to accept payment that way even though there is a fee involved for each received transaction. There is no fee when persons exchange money this way.

Svensk krona (Swedish crown) SEK, Swedish crown to euro: 1 krona = 0.101718488 euros Euro to Swedish crown: 1 euro = 9.83105453 kronor Swedish crown to U.S. dollar: 1 krona = 0.12726 U.S. dollars U.S. dollar to Swedish crown: 1 dollar = 7.85792865 kronor  All currency rates are noted 2nd of February 2018
